title: Lava Kush Mishra
text:
Hi Folks!
It‚Äôs been a while now, working as a Data Scientist. it‚Äôs a great experience and learning where I have worked on multiple domains like Geospatial, Image Analytics, Aerospace, Insurance, Condition based monitoring, forecasting, NLP etc..
Data Science provides me an opportunity to explore multiple domains and work with brilliant minds across the domains. It is really a magical experience to see how Data Science is changing our world exponentially and I am glad that I am also part of this journey.
Data Science is a vast field and it has it‚Äôs own life cycle. every data scientist follows this in each project. It‚Äôs very import for everyone to understand data science life cycle properly before deep dive in this field as this is the first step.
This page is a one stop shop where I will be sharing my blogs related to data science stuffs. we will talk how to follow data science life cycle step by step, what are key aspect of data science, data processing, EDA, data modelling, how to deploy a model and other important topics.
Stay Tuned!!


Click here to check out my blog.

title: Lava Kush Mishra
text: Welcome to my Github Page. This is one stop shop for my articles. please feel free to reach out to me, if you have any query. Thanks!!

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text: This article is originally posted on medium, link is given below.

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#understanding-of-business-problem
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#understanding-of-business-problem
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text:
1. Understanding of Business Problem:

Photo by Jonathan Forage on Unsplash
‚ÄúSuppose, Mohan started his adventurous journey with his friends and unfortunately he gets separated from his friends in the middle. Now, he is all alone in an unknown place. suddenly, he realizes that he doesn‚Äôt know his destination also because he did not discuss journey plan with his friends, he was just enjoying the route.‚Äù üòÆ
Now, I hope you can better understand from the above example that it can happen in our project journey also if we don‚Äôt have proper understanding of our business problem and project roadmap.
It is required to have a good discussion with the stakeholders and top managements about business problem and their expectation from the team. To make this easy, we should have clear idea of below questions before deep dive into ant project.

What is the business requirement?
Why do we need to do this?
What is the expectation from the project?
What are the business constraints involved in project?
What is the acceptable margin?
how can we get the required data?

These are few examples. It can vary based on your project requiremets and expectations.

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#data-gathering
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#data-gathering
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text:
2. Data Gathering:

Photo by Evie S. on Unsplash
Data is like a fuel for any data science project. If we don‚Äôt have proper data and it‚Äôs understanding, it is very difficult to get meaningful insights out of it. we need to have proper discussions with domain experts about the route cause of the problem. We need to collect all data which can be a potential reason for the problem. If data is already available, it is good otherwise we need to talk to the respective teams to provide required data. It is very import to capture all possible scenario in our data sample.
There can be various types of data possible for a data science project. For example, if we are working on forecasting project, we will using time series data. If we are working on image analytics, we will be working on image dataset.

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#data-processing
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#data-processing
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text:
3. Data Processing:

Photo by Joshua Sortino on Unsplash
Data processing is the combination of multiple processes like data cleaning, feature engineering, feature selection etc..
Few of the important steps, of data processing can be seen below:

Combine all relevant datasets properly and create a consolidated dataset
Data cleaning should be done based on statistical approaches.
Handle all null values by removing or replacing it with appropriate values
Remove outliers present in the data using multiple statistical techniques like boxplot etc.
Remove unwanted data from the dataset
Convert the data into required format and provide it in the desired location.

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#exploratory-data-analysis
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#exploratory-data-analysis
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text:
4. Exploratory Data Analysis:

Photo by Stephen Phillips - Hostreviews.co.uk on Unsplash
Once, we are done with data processing, we should analyze the data to get meaning insights from it. This method includes in-depth analysis of data using statistical approaches and graphs like bar graphs, scatter plot etc.
This step is very important because it helps us to understand the data pattern and improve our model performance.

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#data-modeling
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#data-modeling
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text:
5. Data Modeling:

Photo by Laura Ockel on Unsplash
This step is the core of the data science life cycle (DSLC). In this step, we transform our data into our desired form and use it for further applications. This step includes identification of proper method (selection of an appropriate techniques like classification, regression or clustering) and selection of data model. Once, model is selected, we need to focus on hyper parameters tuning which is directly related to model performance. Optimization of hyper parameters help to achieve best possible performance of the model. Model evaluation is also an integral part of model performance optimization. Model evaluation metrics (mse, mspe, log-loss, ROC-AUC curve etc..) should be selected in such a way so that it can calculate errors after each steps which should be handled by model optimizer.

objectID: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#model-deployment
href: posts/DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE/index.html#model-deployment
title: DATA SCIENCE LIFE CYCLE ‚Äî AT A GLANCE
text:
6. Model Deployment:

Model Deployment
This is the final stage of data science life cycle. Once model is optimized and ready to use, we need to deploy it in production environment so that it can be used for further applications.
This step varies based on the end user requirement. We need to transform our model output in desired format so that it can fulfil business requirement.

title: DATA SCIENCE ‚Äî A NEW ERA

title: DATA SCIENCE ‚Äî A NEW ERA
text:
Branches of Science:
There are three main branches of science which are as follows:

Physical Science: This branch deals with Non-living materials, Natural laws and energy.
Life Science: This branch deals with living bodies present on the earth.
Earth Science: As name says, this is the study of earth and space.
